title: Understanding Imaginal Exposure
text: Imaginal exposure is a therapeutic technique used in cognitive-behavioral therapy. It involves confronting fears in a controlled way.

title: Purpose of Imaginal Exposure
text: The goal of imaginal exposure is to reduce the emotional response to a feared situation or memory by repeatedly confronting it in a safe environment.

hintAnswer: mentally confronting and engaging with a feared situation, traumatic memory, or $$anxiety-provoking$$ thought in a safe and controlled environment
